entry.title: How GitHub uses merge queue to ship hundreds of changes every day
entry.summary:

entry.title: Efficiently fine-tune the ESM-2 protein language model with Amazon SageMaker
entry.summary: In this post, we demonstrate how to efficiently fine-tune a state-of-the-art protein language model (pLM) to predict protein subcellular localization using Amazon SageMaker. Proteins are the molecular machines of the body, responsible for everything from moving your muscles to responding to infections. Despite this variety, all proteins are made of repeating chains of molecules called […]

entry.title: Keeping repository maintainer information accurate
entry.summary:

entry.title: Unlocking Innovation: AWS and Anthropic push the boundaries of generative AI together
entry.summary: Amazon Bedrock is the best place to build and scale generative AI applications with large language models (LLM) and other foundation models (FMs). It enables customers to leverage a variety of high-performing FMs, such as the Claude family of models by Anthropic, to build custom generative AI applications. entry.title: Knowledge Bases for Amazon Bedrock now supports hybrid search
entry.summary: At AWS re:Invent 2023, we announced the general availability of Knowledge Bases for Amazon Bedrock. With a knowledge base, you can securely connect foundation models (FMs) in Amazon Bedrock to your company data for fully managed Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). In a previous post, we described how Knowledge Bases for Amazon Bedrock manages the end-to-end […]

entry.title: Unlock personalized experiences powered by AI using Amazon Personalize and Amazon OpenSearch Service
entry.summary: OpenSearch is a scalable, flexible, and extensible open source software suite for search, analytics, security monitoring, and observability applications, licensed under the Apache 2.0 license. Amazon OpenSearch Service is a fully managed service that makes it straightforward to deploy, scale, and operate OpenSearch in the AWS Cloud. entry.title: Automate Amazon SageMaker Pipelines DAG creation
entry.summary: Creating scalable and efficient machine learning (ML) pipelines is crucial for streamlining the development, deployment, and management of ML models. In this post, we present a framework for automating the creation of a directed acyclic graph (DAG) for Amazon SageMaker Pipelines based on simple configuration files. The framework code and examples presented here only cover […]

entry.title: Build a robust text-to-SQL solution generating complex queries, self-correcting, and querying diverse data sources
entry.summary: Structured Query Language (SQL) is a complex language that requires an understanding of databases and metadata. Today, generative AI can enable people without SQL knowledge. This generative AI task is called text-to-SQL, which generates SQL queries from natural language processing (NLP) and converts text into semantically correct SQL. The solution in this post aims to […]

entry.title: How Axfood enables accelerated machine learning throughout the organization using Amazon SageMaker
entry.summary: This is a guest post written by Axfood AB. entry.title: Techniques and approaches for monitoring large language models on AWS
entry.summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) have revolutionized the field of natural language processing (NLP), improving tasks such as language translation, text summarization, and sentiment analysis. entry.title: Best practices for managing Terraform State files in AWS CI/CD Pipeline

entry.title: Run ML inference on unplanned and spiky traffic using Amazon SageMaker multi-model endpoints
entry.summary: Amazon SageMaker multi-model endpoints (MMEs) are a fully managed capability of SageMaker inference that allows you to deploy thousands of models on a single endpoint. Previously, MMEs pre-determinedly allocated CPU computing power to models statically regardless the model traffic load, using Multi Model Server (MMS) as its model server.
